Consider a function p(x) defined by p(x):=\sum_{n=0}^\infty {{sn}}x^n.
Find p_{ {{k}} }(x), the degree {{k}} polynomial approximation for p(x).
Use p_{ {{k}} }(x) to estimate p({{c}}) by computing p_{ {{k}} }({{c}}).
Use p_{ {{k}} }(x) to estimate \displaystyle \int_{ {{a}} }^{ {{b}} }p(x)dx by computing \displaystyle \int_{ {{a}} }^{ {{b}} }p_{ {{k}} }(x)dx.
